SEARCH
Package koopa.core.streams

Class BaseStream

java.lang.Object
koopa.core.streams.BaseStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
Stream
public class BaseStream extends Object implements Stream
This is not so much a stream, as a parse in progress. It holds on to all Tokens it consumed from a Source, and Markers which were added by the grammar, until (that part of) the parse has been completed. At that time it forwards the result to the Target.

When the parse is complete (either successfully or not) the BaseStream will no longer be holding on to any Data itself. In particular, any Tokens which were consumed but did not match will have been returned to their Source.

  • Field Details

    • source

      private final Source source
      The stream fetches Tokens from this Source.

    • pendingData

      private final HoldingTarget pendingData
      Everything the parser has processed, but which has not been committed yet in full.

      This Target is basically a buffer leading up to the real target, but for which we can control the release of its data, and even take data back.

    • delayed

      private final List<Marker> delayed
      A list of Markers which are yet to be passed to the pendingData.

    • allBookmarks

      private final List<BaseStream.Bookmark> allBookmarks
      A list of all BaseStream.Bookmark ever made for this BaseStream. We want to recycle these as a lot of bookmarks will get set and rewound, causing the cost of instantiation to quickly add up.

    • nextActiveBookmark

      private int nextActiveBookmark
      This points into the allBookmarks list, identifying the next BaseStream.Bookmark to be used, or where to insert a new one.

    • parse

      private Parse parse
      The Parse this stream is part of.

  • Method Details

    • forward

      public Data forward()
      Get the next data in the stream.

      This will force any delayed markers. Cfr. Stream.insert(Marker).

      Specified by:
      forward in interface Stream

    • skip

      public Data skip()
      Get the next data in the stream.

      This will not force any delayed markers. Cfr. Stream.insert(Marker).

      Specified by:
      skip in interface Stream

    • insert

      public void insert(Marker marker)
      This inserts a given marker at the current position. When the stream gets committed the marker will be sent along to the target. When the stream gets rollbacked the marker will be removed instead.

      Certain markers may get "delayed". This means they don't get pushed to the target until something else comes along which forces it to.

      Right now all Start markers may be delayed. This way any skipped tokens which come right after a Start marker end up before it, which means they won't become part of the subtree being marked.

      Specified by:
      insert in interface Stream

    • weShouldDelay

      private boolean weShouldDelay(Marker marker)
      Should we delay a certain marker before inserting it into the pendingData list ? Delaying it makes it possible for "skipped" tokens to move in front of these markers.

      Right now all Start markers may be delayed. This way any skipped tokens which come right after a Start marker end up before it, which means they won't become part of the subtree being marked.

    • delay

      private void delay(Marker marker)
      Delay the given marker.

      It is assumed the given marker has passed the tests in weShouldDelay(Marker).

    • insertDelayedMarkers

      private void insertDelayedMarkers()
      Add all delayed markers to the pendingData list.

    • rewind

      public void rewind(Data data)
      Move the stream back towards where we're just about to see this token.

      We expect data to be rewound in the order in which they were given.

      Specified by:
      rewind in interface Stream

    • peek

      public Data peek()
      Get a look at the next upcoming Data without it actually getting consumed.
      Specified by:
      peek in interface Stream

    • peekMore

      public String peekMore()
      This is for tracing purposes. Gives a textual representation of up to five upcoming tokens.
      Specified by:
      peekMore in interface Stream

    • bookmark

      public void bookmark()
      Bookmark the current position in the stream. This will impact the behaviour of rewind() and commit().
      Specified by:
      bookmark in interface Stream

    • rewind

      public void rewind()
      Moves the stream back towards the last bookmark, or to the last commit.

      Anything that's not a Token will get removed again.

      Specified by:
      rewind in interface Stream

    • rewindTo

      private void rewindTo(int position)

    • commit

      public void commit()
      Commit all Datas the latest bookmark (in effect removing it). You won't be able to rewind beyond this point again.

      If there was no bookmark then this will commit the entire stream so far, which means pushing all tokens to that given Target.

      Specified by:
      commit in interface Stream

    • getParse

      public Parse getParse()
      The currently active Parse.
      Specified by:
